title: The J. William Holland Memorial Lecture: Chariot and Horse in the Ancient World—From the Plains of Troy to the Circus Maximus in Rome
hero_caption: Statuette of a Horse, 750/730 BC. Greek. Katherine K. Adler, Costa A. Pandaleon Greek Memorial, and Mr. and Mrs. Walter Alexander Classical Endowment, James H. Allan and Christopher …
description:
Archaeologist John R. Hale (University of Louisville) explores the epic story of the early domestication of the horse on the steppes of Western Asia, the invention of the chariot as a fast-moving platform for archers and royal leaders, and the evidence for its transformative impact in kingdoms and empires from the Mediterranean to China.

Presented by the Classical Art Society
